intro: Fagonia mysorensis, commonly known as the Mysore fagonia, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub structure. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often accompanied by compound leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to dry climates. Fagonia mysorensis is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in herbal remedies.
